Description: Rim and body fragment of large North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; glaze mostly fired red-brown; interior glazed with added purple and white paint: red band lined in white above tongue pattern with incised outline, tongues alternately red, glaze and white; exterior, cream slip: short tongues at rim; below, lion to left, raising its right foreleg; worn red patches on neck and shoulder of lion; field ornaments: rosettes and blobs; below, band with added red band lined in white; metope frieze with groups of vertical lines and dots in zone below. Drill hole in broken edge from sampling for clay analysis.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 45)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.241)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.19)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
